00:00:02:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:02:090000.Dialogue: I'm just gonna run to the store and get a few things. I'll pick you up when you're done.

00:00:05:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:05:080000.Dialogue: Okay. I like it a little better when you stay, but all right.

00:00:10:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:10:210000.Dialogue: Hello. I'm here for my haircut with Mr. D'Onofrio.

00:00:14:010000.Speaker: Barber
00:00:14:010000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, Uncle Tony's in the hospital. He's pretty sick.

00:00:17:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:17:040000.Dialogue: Oh, dear, Mr. D'Onofrio's in the hospital. Why do these things always happen to me?

00:00:24:090000.Speaker: Barber
00:00:24:090000.Dialogue: I can cut it for you.

00:00:28:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:28:060000.Dialogue: I get my hair cut by Mr. D'Onofrio. You believe this guy?

00:00:33:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:33:130000.Dialogue: Excuse us for a second. Sheldon, it's okay, he can do it. He's a barber.

00:00:37:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:37:130000.Dialogue: He's not a barber, he's the nephew.

00:00:40:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:40:080000.Dialogue: He's an example of the kind of nepotism that runs rampant in the barbering industry.

00:00:45:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:45:040000.Dialogue: Besides, Mr. D'Onofrio knows exactly how I like my hair done because he has all my haircut records from my barber in Texas.

00:00:54:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:54:100000.Dialogue: When I first moved here, I was nervous about finding a new barber, so my mother had all my haircut records sent here to Mr. D'Onofrio.

00:01:03:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:03:060000.Dialogue: There's no such thing as haircut records.

00:01:10:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:10:170000.Dialogue: No, but my mother assured me they were sent here, and I'll bet you dollars to donuts that this one doesn't have them.

00:01:17:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:17:070000.Dialogue: Uh, excuse me. Do you have access to my haircut records?

00:01:22:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:22:190000.Dialogue: To paraphrase T.S. Eliot, this is the way the world ends-- not with a bang but with a nephew.

00:01:30:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:30:080000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you're a grown man, he's a professional, and your haircut is number three on that poster from 1946. Just sit down and let him do it.

00:01:40:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:40:030000.Dialogue: Fine, but if I come out of this looking like a dork, it's on you.

00:01:52:120000.Speaker: Barber
00:01:52:120000.Dialogue: So my kid said the funniest thing today.

00:01:59:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:59:080000.Dialogue: When you tell this story later, the word we usually use is quirky.

00:02:30:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:30:090000.Dialogue: Can you pass the Parmesan cheese?

00:02:43:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:43:120000.Dialogue: I'm trying to get the hair out of my eyes.

00:02:45:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:45:160000.Dialogue: LEONARD: Sheldon, you are one day late for your haircut.

00:02:49:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:49:020000.Dialogue: Thank you for captioning my nightmare.

00:02:53:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:53:150000.Dialogue: Lookie here, I got my travel orders.

00:02:57:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:57:170000.Dialogue: Payload Specialist Howard Wolowitz is requested to report to the NASA Johnson Space Center, Houston, Texas, for astronaut training Monday 8:00 a.m.

00:03:05:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:05:210000.Dialogue: Yeah, but it's from NASA, so it's 0800.

00:03:14:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:14:070000.Dialogue: It doesn't have an O in front of it.

00:03:16:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:16:090000.Dialogue: You know what does have an oh in front of it? Oh, my God, I'm an astronaut, and you're dying of jealousy.

00:03:23:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:23:230000.Dialogue: So, what kind of things are they...? Will you stop that?

00:03:27:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:27:190000.Dialogue: I can't help it, I feel like a teen heartthrob.

00:03:33:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:33:190000.Dialogue: You know, Sheldon, I used to cut my brother's hair. I could do it for you.

00:03:36:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:36:200000.Dialogue: Penny, I know you mean well, offering the skills of the hill folk, but, um, here in town, we don't churn our own butter, we don't make dresses out of gunny sacks, and, uh, we sure as shootin' don't get our hair cut by bottle-blonde...

00:03:53:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:53:220000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, it's the bad boy attitude that comes with this hair.

00:04:01:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:01:160000.Dialogue: You could go to my guy. He's at Juan-Juan in Beverly Hills. They bring you a cup of tea, they'll massage your scalp. It's about $200, but sometimes you look in the next chair and you see a superstar like Tony Danza.

00:04:14:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:14:040000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ: Quick question here: Have we actually changed the conversation from I'm going to astronaut training

00:04:18:180000.Speaker: howard
00:04:18:180000.Dialogue: to Sheldon can't get a haircut?

00:04:21:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:21:130000.Dialogue: Now who's dying of jealousy? Oh, it's you.

00:04:48:020000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing her harp.
00:04:48:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:04:48:020000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you're ruining girlfriend- boyfriend sing-along night.

00:04:51:030000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing her harp.
00:04:51:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:51:030000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. I'm looking for a barber and I'm running out of time. My hair is growing at the rate of 4.6 yoctometers per femtosecond. I mean, if you're quiet, you can hear it.

00:05:05:140000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing her harp.
00:05:05:140000.Speaker: Amy

00:05:08:100000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing her harp.
00:05:08:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:08:100000.Dialogue: I tried once. They do men's and women's hair in the same room at the same time. It's like Sodom and Gomorrah with mousse.

00:05:16:020000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing her harp.
00:05:16:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:16:020000.Dialogue: Well, this isn't a crisis. Why don't you just let your hair grow out a little?

00:05:20:190000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing her harp.
00:05:20:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:20:190000.Dialogue: Why don't I let my hair grow out? Um, why don't I start wearing Birkenstocks and seeking validation of my opinions by asking Can you dig it?

00:05:30:060000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing her harp.
00:05:30:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:30:060000.Dialogue: Well, I don't know. I think you might look sexy with long hair.

00:05:36:070000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing her harp.
00:05:36:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:36:070000.Dialogue: The kind that flows down to your shoulders and blows back while riding on a horse.

00:05:44:140000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing her harp.
00:05:44:140000.Speaker: Amy

00:05:49:120000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing her harp.
00:05:49:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:49:120000.Dialogue: I'm gonna go brush my teeth; it might take a while.

00:06:01:010000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:01:010000.Dialogue: I miss you, too. So tell me all about your first day.

00:06:05:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:05:040000.Dialogue: Oh, wow, where do I even start? I got to experience zero gravity.

00:06:10:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:10:230000.Dialogue: Cool. How do they do that?

00:06:12:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:12:070000.Dialogue: It's pretty neat. You get in this plane that goes almost straight up for, like, 20 seconds, and then straight back down like it's going to crash, and they do it over and over again, you know, no matter how many times you throw up.

00:06:30:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:30:120000.Dialogue: Yeah... and the craziest part is, because there's no gravity, the throw-up kind of floats there...

00:06:38:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:38:190000.Dialogue: in a little ball, and if your mouth is open because you're screaming...

00:06:46:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:46:140000.Dialogue: ...sometimes it just floats right back in.

00:06:53:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:53:000000.Dialogue: Boy, does everyone laugh at you when that happens.

00:06:57:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:57:060000.Dialogue: No. Yeah, I would have laughed, too, but I didn't want the vomit to come back out.

00:07:04:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:04:230000.Dialogue: Anyway... Oh, could you do me a favor and overnight me some more underwear?

00:07:13:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:13:130000.Dialogue: I got a look at the centrifuge they're going to spin me around in tomorrow, and I have a hunch I packed a little light.

00:07:32:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:32:080000.Dialogue: They didn't have anything barber-themed in the gift shop, so I got you this. I don't know if you can read his little T-shirt. It says, um, Get well bear-y soon.

00:07:44:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:44:160000.Dialogue: Trust me, if you were even a little conscious right now, you'd be laughing.

00:07:54:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:54:020000.Dialogue: There's new studies that show, people in comas are aware of everything going on around them. With that in mind, if you can hear me, move away from the light and toward the sound of these scissors.

00:08:12:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:12:150000.Dialogue: Yes. Do you have something I could use as a cape?

00:08:17:200000.Speaker: Nurse
00:08:17:200000.Dialogue: Oh, dear, did we spit out our pills, slip out of the ninth floor, and go on a little adventure?

00:08:24:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:24:010000.Dialogue: Oh, no, no, I'm just here to get my hair cut.

00:08:31:210000.Speaker: Nurse
00:08:31:210000.Dialogue: I-I see. J-Jus-Just wait here one moment. Security!

00:08:38:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:38:200000.Dialogue: I got to run. But not with scissors-- that would be unsafe.

00:08:49:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:49:070000.Dialogue: So, if I move my horsey here...

00:09:07:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:07:130000.Dialogue: Well, is it or isn't it?

00:09:11:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:11:110000.Dialogue: You know, I think this is a good stopping point.

00:09:15:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:15:080000.Dialogue: Uh, it's your first real game. I threw a lot of information at you.

00:09:19:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:19:030000.Dialogue: Well, no, I mean, your king is trapped. He can't go here because of my lighthouse,

00:09:24:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:24:110000.Dialogue: and... he can't go here because of my pointy-head guy.

00:09:35:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:35:030000.Dialogue: So did I win or not?

00:09:37:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:37:090000.Dialogue: Did you have fun? Because if you had fun, then you are, you are a winner. That's, that-that's what chess is all about.

00:09:45:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:45:100000.Dialogue: Oh, hey. Sorry, Sheldon, I'll move.

00:09:46:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:46:100000.Dialogue: Eh, why? My spot, your spot-- what difference does it make?

00:09:57:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:57:160000.Dialogue: I don't know. Between you playing chess like Bobby Fischer and Sheldon being okay with you in his spot, I'm guessing someone went back in time, stepped on a bug, and changed the course of human events.

00:10:09:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:09:210000.Dialogue: Uh, sweetie, are you all right?

00:10:12:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:12:090000.Dialogue: No, I'm not all right. It's been six days since I was supposed to get a haircut and nothing horrible has happened.

00:10:20:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:20:000000.Dialogue: Okay, I'm sorry, I don't understand.

00:10:29:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:29:010000.Dialogue: I have spent my whole life trying to bring order to the universe by carefully planning every moment of every day. But all my efforts-- our dinner schedule, my pajama rotation, my bowel movement spreadsheet--

00:10:41:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:41:180000.Dialogue: it's clear now, I've been wasting my time.

00:10:46:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:46:010000.Dialogue: Good. I'm taking that disgusting chart off the fridge.

00:10:50:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:50:090000.Dialogue: You know, Sh-Sheldon, sometimes it's nice not knowing what's coming. I mean, look at me and Leonard. We went out, we broke up, now we're trying again. We don't know what's gonna happen.

00:10:59:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:59:140000.Dialogue: Oh, please, everyone knows what's going to happen.

00:11:06:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:06:020000.Dialogue: I think this could be good for you. Maybe it's time for you to shake things up a bit.

00:11:10:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:10:080000.Dialogue: You're right. I should embrace the chaos.

00:11:14:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:14:180000.Dialogue: Great. What are you going to do first?

00:11:17:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:17:230000.Dialogue: I don't know. I could do anything. All bets are off. The world is my oyster.

00:11:25:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:25:220000.Dialogue: I got it. I'm going to put on my Tuesday pajamas tonight.

00:11:35:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:35:020000.Dialogue: I got to tell you, I'm a little worried about him.

00:11:37:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:37:160000.Dialogue: If I were you, I'd be worried that a girl who's never played chess in her life just kicked your ass.

00:12:00:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:00:100000.Dialogue: We did overnight survival training in the wilderness.

00:12:08:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:08:220000.Dialogue: I was gonna freshen up for you but I blacked out a little on the way to the bathroom.

00:12:17:030000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:17:030000.Dialogue: Survival training? Is that like camping?

00:12:19:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:19:080000.Dialogue: Uh-huh. Except you don't have food or water, and they don't have a sunset Sabbath service like they do at Camp Hess-Kramer.

00:12:32:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:32:050000.Dialogue: No. I slept in a hole I dug in the ground with my bare hands.

00:12:39:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:39:200000.Dialogue: And at some point during the night, an armadillo crawled in

00:12:52:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:52:180000.Dialogue: But I did it. I survived. I wasn't sure I was going to when the sandstorm hit.

00:13:00:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:00:080000.Dialogue: I just pulled my turtleneck up over my head and waited for death.

00:13:07:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:07:180000.Dialogue: But somehow as I sat there, wrapped in a cocoon of my own neck-sweat, I found that primal part of the human spirit that just wants to keep on living, no matter what the cost.

00:13:27:110000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:27:110000.Dialogue: You're so brave. I'm proud of you.

00:13:54:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:54:070000.Dialogue: No, I don't think it's possible. I'm severely dehydrated.

00:14:04:050000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:04:050000.Dialogue: Howie, if you're not able to do this, come home. It won't change how I feel about you.

00:14:11:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:11:030000.Dialogue: Thanks, honey, but I can't quit. If I do, I'll just be a guy who had a chance to be an astronaut and gave it up.

00:14:21:050000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:21:050000.Dialogue: Well, is there anything I could do to help?

00:14:39:120000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:14:39:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:39:120000.Dialogue: Don't let this be Sheldon playing bongos.

00:14:58:000000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:14:58:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:58:000000.Dialogue: Hello, Leonard, do you like my bongos?

00:15:03:040000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:03:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:03:040000.Dialogue: Bet you didn't know that I had bongos.

00:15:07:170000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:07:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:07:170000.Dialogue: Sheldon, it's 3:00 o'clock in the morning.

00:15:09:160000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:09:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:09:160000.Dialogue: 3:00 in the morning is a good time for bongos.

00:15:14:160000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:14:160000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:16:070000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:16:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:16:070000.Dialogue: Leonard sleeps while I play bongos.

00:15:20:160000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:20:160000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:22:230000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:22:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:22:230000.Dialogue: Leonard no sleep while I play bongos. Bongo solo.

00:15:32:030000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:32:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:32:030000.Dialogue: Stop! Stop it! Stop! Stop! Stop it!

00:15:40:160000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:40:160000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:46:090000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:46:090000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:48:000000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:48:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:48:000000.Dialogue: Richard Feynman played the bongos. I thought I'd give that a try.

00:15:51:070000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:51:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:51:070000.Dialogue: Richard Feynman was a famous physicist.

00:15:53:010000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:53:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:53:010000.Dialogue: Oh, Leonard, it's 3:00 o'clock in the morning. I don't care if Richard Feynman was a purple leprechaun who lived in my butt.

00:15:59:120000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:15:59:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:59:120000.Dialogue: Penny meant if he were a purple leprechaun. Penny forgot to use the subjunctive.

00:16:06:220000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:16:06:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:06:220000.Dialogue: Sheldon, go to bed. You have work in the morning.

00:16:11:020000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:16:11:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:11:020000.Dialogue: Maybe, maybe not. Maybe tomorrow I start a bongo band and tour the world.

00:16:16:160000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:16:16:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:16:160000.Dialogue: No, no, hang on, uh, uh, Roommate Agreement. No hootenannies, sing-a-longs, or barbershop quartets after 10:00 p.m.

00:16:26:100000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:16:26:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:26:100000.Dialogue: Roommate Agreement? Are you kidding? We are living in a world of chaos.

00:16:32:000000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:16:32:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:35:050000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:16:35:050000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:37:050000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:16:37:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:37:050000.Dialogue: Wherever the music takes me, kitten.

00:16:42:090000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard wakes to the sound of bongos.
00:16:42:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:42:090000.Dialogue: I play bongos walking down the stairs.

00:17:00:210000.Scene: Howard’s hotel room. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:00:210000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:17:01:230000.Scene: Howard’s hotel room. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:01:230000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:03:200000.Scene: Howard’s hotel room. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:03:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:03:200000.Dialogue: I'm here to help you get through this. You can't do it on your own, you need someone to take care of you.

00:17:08:230000.Scene: Howard’s hotel room. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:08:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:08:230000.Dialogue: Oh, I love you so much.

00:17:10:070000.Scene: Howard’s hotel room. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:10:070000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:17:11:140000.Scene: Howard’s hotel room. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:11:140000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:17:11:140000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Howard, your bath is getting cold!

00:17:17:020000.Scene: Howard’s hotel room. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:17:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:17:020000.Dialogue: Don't worry, once she falls asleep, I'll spoon you like an armadillo.

00:17:26:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:26:110000.Dialogue: He showed up in the middle of the night with his bongos.

00:17:30:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:30:130000.Dialogue: I foolishly thought it was some sort of musical booty call.

00:17:35:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:35:120000.Dialogue: Poor guy. He must have been exhausted. Sheldon like to sleep while Leonard play the bongo!

00:17:45:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:45:160000.Dialogue: That was kind of uncalled for.

00:17:52:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:52:000000.Dialogue: All right, Sheldon, this craziness has gone on long enough. Please come home so I can cut your hair.

00:17:56:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:56:190000.Dialogue: Penny, you're not trained. You're not licensed. Most importantly, you don't have access to my haircut records.

00:18:07:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:07:110000.Dialogue: All right, honey, look, we've known each other for a long time now, right? I've taken you to Disneyland, I kicked a bully in the nuts for you, I sing you Soft Kitty when you're sick, you've even saw me naked once.

00:18:25:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:25:020000.Dialogue: It was a long story. Anyway, Sheldon, I promise I know what I'm doing. Please let me cut your hair.

00:18:33:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:33:220000.Dialogue: There's not a hair on my body I wouldn't  let this woman trim.

00:18:51:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:51:170000.Dialogue: Thank you for letting me sleep on your couch.
